page.title: 13EDINBURGH,GIRLS SCHOOL 1952
page.content: To learn about changes in St Margarets since 1952, we invited former pupils and teachers to tea in the History classrooms and taped our interviews. In 1952 there were 280 girls. Most of the boarders were at Auchterarder, Perthshire, still evacuated after the war. Everything seemed smaller and quieter but not so very different. Still green tunics, skirts and blazers but hats were worn, felt in Winter and straw in Summer. Almost everyone ate school lunches, liver and semolina unwillingly though! At break milk and a sticky bun. One rule said that no pupil in uniform was to enter a sweet shop. Now we buy kit-kats from a school machine. School House was the only teaching block; now there are ten. We would have missed our new library, computer rooms and labs!
